Tomáš Juřica

Prague & Brno, Czech Republic · +420 774 989 814 · tomasjuri@gmail.com

Computer-vision and machine-learning engineer focused on bringing cutting-edge CV and embedded-AI solutions from research to real-world products. Passionate life-long learner with solid academic background and hands-on experience designing, training and optimising deep-learning models for high-performance deployment.

Experience

Machine Learning Engineer

Veracity Protocol

I developed and trained machine-learning algorithms for physical-object identification and verification, including ID cards, passports, banknotes and collectibles. I specialised in PCB defect-detection, creating CNNs for visual inspection and segmentation and optimising models with TensorRT and ONNX for high-performance inference. I also led the delivery of a key project for a US client, building a custom camera-scanner for tracking and verifying collectible items.

Mar 2019 – Present

Computer Vision Researcher

Innovatrics

At Innovatrics I was a member of the R&D team, primarily focusing on the preparation of machine-learning models and datasets for face-recognition and identification. I also actively contributed to projects aimed at bringing automated visual inspection into manufacturing, specifically leveraging the Mask R-CNN semantic-segmentation model to accurately segment defects on IC cards.

Jan 2017 – Feb 2019

Computer Vision Engineer

NXP Semiconductors

My main responsibility was the implementation and optimisation of computer-vision algorithms for embedded processors such as i.MX6 and i.MX8. My biggest achievement was an optimised stereo-vision algorithm whose state-of-the-art real-time performance was achieved on an embedded GPGPU.

Jul 2016 – Dec 2017

Education

Brno University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology

Master of Science – Embedded Systems

Thesis: Machine-learning visual inspection and defect-detection in manufacturing.

Sep 2016 – Jun 2019

Brno University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology

Bachelor of Science – Computer Science
Sep 2013 – Jun 2016
